answers.answer: HiSorry to hear that your mum is not well.  Has she been diagnosed with stroke?Just to clear things up, speech difficulties such as mumbling are often a *symptom* of stroke not a cause.  Similarly, depression can occur after a stroke during recovery, it does not cause stroke.The speech problems result when the part of the brain that is responsible for speech is damaged by the stroke.Stroke are usually diagnosed by a CT &/or MRI scan.  Causes of strokes are usually diagnosed by a range of clinical & laboratory tests.  As each stroke is different, it is impossible for me to tell you the cause.  Please speak with your mothers doctors.The brain is a remarkable organ.  Whilst the dead parts stay dead, it can lear to "re-route" the signals, so a different part of the brain takes over the duties of the part that died.  So yes, recovery is possible, the extent of recovery is dependent on the amount of damage & the person's commitment to rehabilitation.HTHSue
